net.philsprojects.live
Interface PropertyValidator<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of value stored in the property.
public interface PropertyValidator<T>

Each property has a single validator to determine whether a change in value can occur.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Method Summary
 boolean isValidValue(Property<T> property, T oldValue, T newValue)
          Validates whether the new value is an acceptable change from the current value.
 

Method Detail

isValidValue

boolean isValidValue(Property<T> property,
                     T oldValue,
                     T newValue)
Validates whether the new value is an acceptable change from the current value.

Parameters:
property - The property being changed.
oldValue - The current value of the property.
newValue - The new value for the property.
Returns:
True if the newValue is valid, otherwise false.
